identificationModule.officialTitle: Development of an International Multicenter Registry of Patients With Monogenic and Polygenic Autoinflammatory Diseases Aimed at Clinical and Therapeutical Data Collection and Analysis

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Autoinflammatory diseases (AID) are clinical entities characterized by recurrent inflammatory attacks in absence of infection, neoplasm or deregulation of the adaptive immune system. Among them, hereditary periodic syndromes, also known as monogenic AID, represent the prototype of this disease group, caused by mutations in genes involved in the regulation of innate immunity, inflammation and cell death. Based on recent experimental acquisitions in the field of monogenic AID, several immunologic disorders have been reclassified as polygenic/multifactorial AID, sharing pathogenetic and clinical features with hereditary periodic fevers. This has paved the way to new treatment targets for patients suffering from rare diseases of unknown origin, including Behçet's disease, Still disease, Schnitzler's disease, PFAPA (periodic fever, aphthous stomatitis, pharyngitis and cervical adenitis) syndrome, chronic recurrent multifocal osteomyelitis (CRMO), non-infectious uveitis and scleritis. Gathering information on such rare conditions is made difficult by the small number of patients, along with the difficulty of obtaining an accurate diagnosis in non-specialized clinical settings.

In this context, the AIDA project promotes international collaboration among clinical centres to develop a permanent registry aimed at collecting demographic, genetic, clinical and therapeutic data of patients affected by monogenic and polygenic AID, in order to expand the current knowledge of these rare conditions.

armGroups.label: Patients affected by autoinflammatory diseases
interventionNames: Other: No intervention is foreseen by the protocol.

interventions.name: No intervention is foreseen by the protocol.
interventions.description: Patients will be observed for 10 years at least. Demographic, genetic, clinical, clinimetric, laboratory, radiologic and therapeutic data will be collected both retrospectively and prospectively during routine follow-up visits.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change of the number of enrolled subjects
primaryOutcomes.description: This is an observational registry. The primary outcome is the increase of the number of subjects enrolled within each nosologic group.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the disease activity score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in the disease activity score specific for the nosologic entity (BDCAF score, Pouchot score, modified Pouchot score, JADAS27/JADAS27(CRP), DAS28) or according to composite indexes that will be defined in each study based on the registry.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the % of patients with new organ involvement
Incidence of death or adverse events
Change in the inflammatory markers values (ESR)
Change in the inflammatory markers values (CRP and SAA)
secondaryOutcomes.description: CRP and SAA measured in mg/dl

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in visual acuity expressed as Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA)
Change in the overall function score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in the overall function score according to HAQ (adults) or CHAQ (children)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the overall damage score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in the overall damage score specific for the nosologic entity (ADDI score, BODI score, JADI score)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in articular pain measured as Visual Analogue Scale for articular Pain (VAS Pain)
Changes in height and weight percentile values for age and sex
Change in the % of patients experiencing fatigue
Change in the % of patients with fertility reduction or pregnancy complications

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of days lost at work/school during the last 3 months, Number of visits/ phone calls to the general practitioner during the last 3 months, Number of accesses to the Emergency Room during the last 6 months, Days of hospitalization during the last 3 months, Overall number of days lost at work by relatives during the last 3 months

eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients consecutively diagnosed and treated at the hospitals/ research centres affiliated to the AIDA Network (https://aidanetwork.org/en/)
